Body: When I try to access secure web sites via https (ssl), I get an error.Chrome error message:Error 107 (net::ERR_SSL_PROTOCOL_ERROR) SSL_Protocol ErrorFirefox error message:ssl_error_rx_record_too_longThe website load correctly on Wifi, but this error shows up when trying to load pages over a cellular data connection.I am running Cyanogenmod 10 (Android 4.1.2) from Bell (Canada), though the problem also happens on stock Android (according to other forums on other carriers).I tried following one person's suggestion to modify the TLD settings in the about:config page for Firefox, but that did not fix the problem.
Title: Resolving SSL Protocol Error on data connection but not on wifi

history.Text: When I try to access https sites I get the following error from chrome    Error 107 (net::ERR_SSL_PROTOCOL_ERROR) SSL_Protocol ErrorIt works fine on wifi. It also works fine when connection to https://google.comI am running cyanogenmod 10 (android 4.1.2) on my galaxy s3 from bell canada.
I get Error 107 (net::ERR_SSL_PROTOCOL_ERROR) SSL_Protocol Error on data connection but not wifi

When I try to access secure web sites I get the following error from Chrome    Error 107 (net::ERR_SSL_PROTOCOL_ERROR) SSL_Protocol ErrorIt works fine on Wifi. It also works fine when connecting to https://google.comI am running Cyanogenmod 10 (Android 4.1.2) on my Galaxy S3 from Bell(Canada).
Resolving SSL Protocol Error on data connection but not on wifi

history.Comment: its a more generalized issue then stated... should be reopened.
history.Text: When I try to access secure web sites via https (ssl)I get the following error from Chrome    Error 107 (net::ERR_SSL_PROTOCOL_ERROR) SSL_Protocol Errorand this in Firefox    ssl_error_rx_record_too_longIt works fine on Wifi.I am running Cyanogenmod 10 (Android 4.1.2) from Bell(Canada). Also happens on stock Android. I have read similar error on other carriers.Their suggestion was to modify the TLS settings in firefox's about:config page, which did not help.

history.Comment: its a more generalized issue then stated... should be reopened.

history.Text: When I try to access secure web sites via https (ssl), I get an error.Chrome error message:    Error 107 (net::ERR_SSL_PROTOCOL_ERROR) SSL_Protocol ErrorFirefox error message:    ssl_error_rx_record_too_longThe website load correctly on Wifi, but this error shows up when trying to load pages over a cellular data connection.I am running Cyanogenmod 10 (Android 4.1.2) from Bell (Canada), though the problem also happens on stock Android (according to other forums on other carriers).I tried following one person's suggestion to modify the TLD settings in the `about:config` page for Firefox, but that did not fix the problem.
